special_features: Commentary by Tom Baker, Louise Jameson, Wanda Ventham and Edward Arthur
After Image - Cast and crew look back on the making of this story
Easter Egg: Louise Jameson bonus interview

notes: This story was the last to be commissioned by script editor Robert Holmes.
This story introduced a new version of Leela's leather outfit.
K9 makes only brief appearances due to a scripting overlap.
Louise Jameson wore her hair up due to a haircut mistake.
There is no clear on-screen indication of how the Doctor escaped a storeroom in part two.
The DVD commentary notes the appearance was Wanda Ventham's first major role post-maternity.
Max Stael's suicide was suggested to be too dark for a family show.

in_universe_mythology: The Fendahl is a god-like entity that feeds on life force.
The Fendahl's skull was found in volcanic sediment in Kenya.
real_world_cultural_references: The hiker whistles 'The Entertainer' by Scott Joplin.
Dr. Fendelman references winning a Nobel Prize.
individuals: Dr. Fendelman is one of the world's richest men.
Ted Moss is involved with a local coven.
items: A twelve million year old skull nicknamed 'Eustace'.

continuity_notes: In a later novel, Colby is still haunted by this story's events.
The Eighth Doctor later released the Fendahl without knowing and encountered it again in 2007.
Leela references Professor Marius from the previous story 'The Invisible Enemy'.

plot.plot_summary: The Fourth Doctor and Leela arrive in present-day Fetchborough, where a fossilized skull linked to the Fendahl, an ancient life-force feeding entity, begins causing havoc. They investigate the Priory where scientists are influenced by the alien skull. As they uncover the mystery, the Fendahl's powers pose a threat requiring the Doctor to destroy the Priory and dispose of the skull to prevent the Fendahl's full regeneration.
